body: A few programs to help with savedata creation. They can create savedata using a provided secret key, e.g. from `cracker.c`, as well as random savedata (not cracking, just random). `create_minimal_savedata.c` replaces `minimal-save-generator.c` because it's the same `minimal-save-generator.c` but with the ability to use a provided key. `create_savedata.c` is the same as `create_minimal_savedata.c` but using Tox API instead of hacking savedata together. It requires `-ltoxcore` and generates bigger savedata. `create_bootstrap_keys.c ` is the same but for bootstrap node keys. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/1818)

comment_data.body:
Add this to other/analysis/gen-file.sh:

```sh
echo "static void call(int m(int, const char *const *), int argc, char **argv) { m(argc, argv); }" >>amalgamation.cc
```

Are you sure? `savedata` doesn't leak, it's `NULL` here.

The issue here is the `tox_kill(tox);` call I forgot to remove after all the refactoring I did, resulting in a double-kill. Fixing that now...
